description: Latin cachinnō (“laugh aloud”), of onomatopoeic origin.

verbs.description: cachinnate (third-person singular simple present cachinnates, present participle cachinnating, simple past and past participle cachinnated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To laugh loudly, immoderately, or too often.
examples: The villain began to cachinnate and twirl his moustache.
